column5: Been a good few years since taking a winter pilgrimage north for some ice fishing. Last week just before all the **** really hit the fan with Corona some buddies and I finished a five day pre-self-quarantine before this weeks recommendations asked all Canadians to now do the same. The fishing for greys was "tough" but in all honesty having the chance to explore the Atikokan area with friends old and new, share great food and drink, visit a century old "castle," and just get away from it all, was a breath of fresh air for everyone. And we did catch fish too!Wrote a picture loaded story about the time. Anyone needing a break from reality is welcome to link in and come along on the trip!.https://bunksoutdoorangle.com/browns...le-grey-trout/Bunk!
Enjoyed your write up and all the cool pics - thanks for posting. Not been there in the winter but have been doing a week long WO open water trip for 35 years now. Its quite a place for sure :-) Dan
That was fun to read! Great pictures too

thanks fellas! Dan, friend of mine been heading up that way with his family through Browns every spring for gotta be near 25-30 years too. They love it! And I can see why... it's truly a beautiful playground up there with LOTS of fishy water.
Bunk - finally got around to reading this one and was worth the wait Sunday AM, big cup of coffee and a Moosebunk report - now thats the way to start a day! Cheers Andrew
With a morning coffee or evening scotch... that's the best way to wash one down. Thanks Andrew.
